name: officer
chn: n. 高级职员, 官员
example_en: The police officer directed traffic at the busy intersection.
example_cn: 警察在繁忙的十字路口指挥交通。
word_family: office (n. 办公室), official (adj. 官方的, n. 官员)
memory_tips: 词根 'offic' 来自拉丁语 'officium'，意为 '服务' 或 '职责'。后缀 '-er' 表示执行某动作的人。可以联想 'office'（办公室）中的 'officer' 是负责管理或执行任务的人。图像记忆：想象一个穿着制服的警察或军官在办公室中执行任务。

image_prompt.main_image: A police officer in uniform standing at a busy intersection, directing traffic with hand signals. The scene is bustling with cars and pedestrians.
image_prompt.example_image: A close-up of a police officer in uniform, gesturing with one hand to stop traffic while holding a walkie-talkie in the other hand. The background shows a busy city street with cars and buildings.

collocations: chief officer (大副); probation officer (缓刑监督官); loan officer (信贷员)
